data.title: Fun times
data.text: We ended up at Howl at the Moon after a business dinner, it was a great time to relax sing and dance and just have some fun.

data.title: Great night out
data.text: Stumbled upon Howl at the Moon on our night out in Louisville. I've been to another one in Indy and this one was a lot better! The performers were awesome and really connected with the crowd! Definitely a good spot to stop by for a drink or two late at night!

data.title: Bachelorette Party
data.text: This place was wonderful! The musicians were top notch. It was interesting to see the four be able to switch up and relieve one another and keep the music sounding so good without skipping a beat. The bouncer/dancer was very entertaining and highlighted the music. There were all age groups present and all genres of music played to encompass everyone's taste. Nicely put together!!

data.title: Not good
data.text: I have been to several howl at the moon's, this was not anywhere near as good as the others (SC or Chicago), they played the full song which was a positive but no energy or enthusiasm in the songs I have heard at other places, singing was flat, I will come back but will not request another song at this location, they really need to expand their music knowledge it they think they are going to do this job

data.title: Touristy party bar in the heart of downtown
data.text: This is a pretty standard-fare touristy place in the downtown part of Louisville. The drinks are overpriced, it's raucous and they serve shots in giant syringes. Warning: f there's a convert or event going on on 4th street outside they will charge you a cover to get into the promenade, plus another cover to enter the bar. The duelling pianos part is ok if that's what you are there to do.

data.title: Best Piano Bar team ever!
data.text: Stopped in here for a couple of drinks with my little sister on a Wednesday evening and stayed until closing! I have been to several dueling piano bars around the country (maybe a dozen?!) and have never seen a group of musicians as talented as these. My sister and I were in awe of the diversity of their playlist and their ability to handle requests from nearly every genre and decade. Simply amazing night! I realize that many of these musicians tour so get there soon or miss out.

data.title: Fourth Street Week
data.text: Very impressed by the dueling pianos and the musicians playing there, stayed a couple of hours, Drinks are expensive, Kentucky Ale Bourbon Barrel at $9.50 a bottle is crazy.... but it is a entertaining spot.

data.title: First Timer
data.text: I had the time of my life and made some new friends. Robert, Hope and Tony...I will be back! The musicians were absolutely amazing and the entire atmosphere was just great. Best bang for your buck...invest in a bucket and try not to drink it all by yourself.

data.title: got to go there
data.text: Greatest Music in town.More fun than anything  we found. All the band members the are super .They keep all of you involved we are looking forward to going back. Jack  the Banana shirt

data.title: Great time...
data.text: Went with a group of friends in the evening. Bar staff was friendly and willing to interact with patrons. The musicians were talented and covered a wide range of music - almost all were request from the audience. As with most places like this, the the enjoyment  & fun factor is created by the patrons attending at that particular time. Featured drinks were pricey, other beverages were more reasonable but all of the drinks were pleasant to drink.

data.title: Excellent Band, Small Dance Floor
data.text: This is your stereotypical dance bar except the band playing was excellent. They were hilarious and talented with a great set. I get the feeling they play there regularly. The dance floor was small and people were packed in. Service at the bar was fairly smooth with so many people. I would recommend this for friends looking to just have a good time.

data.title: Great time listening to great talent
data.text: I absolutely love my times at Howl at the moon in Louisville Kentucky.  I have never been disappointed in the entertainment and we had a very attentive hostess who made sure we were always good with drinks.  Howl is definitely my favorite place for music and fun.  The musicians sing and play a wide variety of songs and sometimes you get a perfect combo of musicians rotated in and they work seamlessly together.  For added bonus we were entertained by an great dancing staff member.  Love the superman shirt!

data.title: Fun
data.text: We had fun on a quiet Tuesday evening. The dueling pianos were entertaining. Not the best signers but they had talent. The waitress Nicole was friendly and on point. We did get annoyed at a staff member tossing a bottle around and dropping it repeatedly behind us. It almost caused us to leave, if she hadn't stopped. Otherwise, it was fun and we'd go back.

data.title: A fun time
data.text: Dueling pianos! There was also a drummer and the piano players each played other instruments (guitar and sax).  They take requests so there is a real variety of music being played, rap, heavy metal, country, folk, current pop, and 70;s rock and roll.  A great time for any age adults!

data.title: Great Music, Great Vibe
data.text: Irrespective of the day of the week, their live band and viibe will get you dancing . No frill place, it is friendly  and the star of 4th street live.

data.title: What a blast!
data.text: I have heard about this place and have always wanted to visit.  Well, I was glad we did! Nothing says fun like dueling pianos! All four of the entertainers were able to play multiple instruments, which is amazing! Give a tip and they play a song. The more you pay the better chances your song will get played. Neat environment and super packed. So if you want a table, I suggest you get there early.

data.title: Great Bar on 4th
data.text: They have great live music with great vibe. I have been there a few different times and it's always been a great time. Only negative (maybe not to some) is that it is always packed! I guess because everyone agrees with me, its a GREAT bar.

data.title: Fun Night Out with Friends
data.text: On a recent trip to Louisville for a conference, several friends and I spent a good night out at Howl at the Moon. Not only was it in walking distance from our hotel, meaning that we could drink a good bit and get ourselves home, but we also wanted a place where we could listen to good music and talk. Sitting at the outside patio was perfect; we could hear excellent bar songs while still carrying on a good conversation. The service was great. There were several of us and we asked for separate checks. No problem. Yeah, the joint is a bit touristy, but that's why we chose it. The only real problem was it cost 40 bucks to audition to sing. Now I know that the place isn't a karaoke joint, but that's extravagant and a bit ridiculous. Otherwise, even though this is a chain, it's a fun place on 4th Street, and lives up to its name. We had a blast.

data.title: Great time
data.text: This was our first stop and it was a great one! The singers/musicians are amazing! They are talented and very entertaining.  This place does not serve food but you can place an order with the hard Rock and they will bring it over. ..so in a way two stops in one

data.title: Expensive drinks & nothing new
data.text: Louisville has an issue with late night pubs. Nothing is open after 12pm and HATM is all that remains. The musicianship is average and the drinks weak. We'll be back for a conference in a few years but I can't say I'm looking forward to it.
